The vulnerability here is:
1. other 2 tasks are basically created client side instead of server side
2. the third task is vulnerable to using golang's builtin `len` function on a string instead of `utf8.RuneCountInString(s))` which returns the number of characters (runes) instead of bytes in the string.


The solve fetch:

```
fetch("http://127.0.0.1/task", {
  "headers": {
    "accept": "*/*",
    "accept-language": "pl-PL,pl;q=0.9,en-US;q=0.8,en;q=0.7",
```
